page.title: 10A MANCUNIAN IN SUDBOROUGH
page.content: At the age of thirteen I moved from Greater Manchester,Altrincham to Sudborough in Northamptonshire. This move was quite expensive and one I could not accept at first. This I think was because I had lived in a busy town with a shopping-centre, lots of night clubs, an ice rink, cinemas and more, and, most important in my mind, friends and people of about my own age. There areplenty of people my age at my new school naturally, but they live quite a long way from my village. Sudborough has no bus routes passing through, so without private transport all you can do is walk. This is another thing I found extremely unusual because buses used to pass every ten minutes in Altrincham. Now I have to rely totally on my parents for transport to discos, parties or shops.
